DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator to ask if a patient has previously had a stroke.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient's cerebrovascular accident history.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A sudden, nonconvulsive loss of neurologic function due to an ischemic or hemorrhagic intracranial vascular event. In general, cerebrovascular accidents are classified by anatomic location in the brain, vascular distribution, etiology, age of the affected individual, and hemorrhagic vs. nonhemorrhagic nature. (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, pp777-810):an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have history
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have history of stroke

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of CVA within the last six months

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA, stroke), transient ischemic attack (TIA) or subarachnoid hemorrhage within six months of the first date of Bevacizumab therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA) <=6 months prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient ever had a cerebrovascular accident (stroke)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of stroke or intracranial hemorrhage within 6 months prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of stroke, cerebrovascular accident (CVA)  or transient ischemic attack (TIA) within 6 months prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a cerebral vascular accident (CVA) or transient ischemic attack (TIA) within 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA) or transient ischemic attack (TIA) within 6 months prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of stroke or transient ischemic attack within six months of study registration?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Chronic Disease Ind-3 (2018845v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1) - dbw
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 1/25/2023: Added an AQT for Alliance to reuse per CADSR0001963.wz
